findings.title: Potential Unbounded Loops in Entry Functions
findings.description: Detected loop-related patterns in bytecode strings. If entry functions iterate over user-controlled vectors without bounds, this may lead to DoS attacks or excessive gas consumption.
findings.recommendation: Verify that loop bounds are properly enforced and consider adding maximum iteration limits.

findings.title: Missing Event Emissions for Sensitive Operations
findings.description: Detected sensitive operations (mint/withdraw/admin/upgrade) but no clear event emission patterns found in bytecode/source. Events are important for off-chain monitoring and transparency.
findings.recommendation: Emit events for all sensitive operations (transfers, mints, burns, admin actions) to enable off-chain monitoring and improve transparency.

locations.note: Sensitive operation without clear event emission

findings.title: External Dependency/Oracle Usage Without Clear Bounds
findings.description: Detected oracle/external dependency patterns (price) but limited bounds checking hints. Oracle manipulation or stale data can lead to financial losses.
findings.recommendation: Verify that oracle values are bounded (min/max) and consider adding staleness checks and multiple oracle sources.
